abstracts.cdata!:
The Barrio Ciudad Project for the
            Republic of Honduras had a moderately satisfactory outcome,
            with moderately satisfactory performances by both the Bank
            and the borrower. Most of the project development outcome
            indicators and the intermediate outcome indicators were
            achieved completely, while the responses of the remaining
            indicated a high level of achievement. Significant lessons
            learned during the implementation of the project were: 1)
            the need to invest in designing a simple yet enforceable
            monitoring and evaluation framework; 2) the importance of
            integrated delivery of physical infrastructure and social
            interventions; 3) placing municipalities in the lead and
            increasing their technical capacity to increase their
            technical capacity and ensure sustainability of
            sub-projects; and 4) the importance of active community
            participation and strengthening of community organization
            structures throughout the entire cycle of the project.

16352705.theme: Municipal governance and institution building,Municipal finance,Urban services and housing for the poor,Other social protection and risk management,City-wide Infrastructure and Service Delivery
16352705.majtheme: Urban development,Social protection and risk management

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Barrio Ciudad
            Project for Honduras is to improve the quality of life for
            the residents in selected poor urban neighborhoods of the
            Borrower in eligible municipalities. The closing date for
            will be extended from June 30, 2012 until June 30, 2013. The
            extension is necessary to benefit an additional 4,000
            residents in the new cities targeted by the second round of
            investments (Puerto Cortez, Choloma, Choluteca, La Ceiba,
            and Danli). Furthermore, the Project has demonstrated
            positive impacts on the prevention of crime and violence in
            the Project's municipalities and it is closely linked
            to the strategic importance of the crime and violence
            prevention agenda of the government. This will be the second
            extension of the project. A first one year extension was
            approved on April 2008, extending the closing date to June
            30, 2012.

display_title.display_title:
Honduras - Barrio Ciudad Project
            : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet

16379984.majtheme: Urban development,Social protection and risk management

abstracts.cdata!:
The Barrio Ciudad Project objective is
            to improve the quality of life for the urban poor in
            Honduras and to enable their municipal governments to
            continue and sustain such improvements through capacity
            building and improved access to credit. The project was
            approved by the Board on July 7, 2005, and became effective
            on March 31, 2006. As of February 14, 2012, the Credit has
            been disbursed at 65 percent (US$ 10.1M of a total of US$
            15M). Furthermore, in the last Implementation Status Report
            (ISR), the project's overall progress towards achieving
            the project development objective was rated moderately
            satisfactory. The project consists of four components: (1)
            neighborhood upgrading; (2) technical assistance; (3) urban
            crime and violence prevention; and (4) project
            administration. The Government of Honduras (GoH) has
            requested the reallocation to increase the total amount to
            US$822,634 in component three and to US$6,248,832 in
            component two to allow for the construction of
            infrastructure for crime and violence prevention and to
            enhance technical assistance to Municipalities respectively.

Honduras - Barrio Ciudad Project
            : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
